newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dow could fall as much as 10 pct -- Blinder.
newsitem.headline: Dow could fall as much as 10 pct -- Blinder.

text.p: Rising U.S. stock prices now pose a downside risk to the economy and it would not be a surprise to see a drop in the Dow Industrials of up to 10 percent anytime now, Alan Blinder, former Federal Reserve vice chairman, said told Reuters Financial Television in an interview on Friday.
"It wouldn't be a big surprise any day, any week, to see a substantial drop," Blinder said, adding that the Dow could fall several hundred points, or between five and 10 percent.
The Dow Industrials set a new closing high on Thursday, finishing 38 points or 0.57 percent higher at 6,765.
But Blinder said stock prices had been resilient and their strength had had a positive effect.

"For a long time, it was a positive factor by lowering the cost of capital for businesses and creating consumer wealth. It is still doing that, but now it's created a certain amount of downside risk," he said.
